author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological thriller that delves into the complexities of guilt and morality, following the story of Rodion Raskolnikov, a young and troubled former student in St. Petersburg.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A masterpiece exploring the intricacies of faith, family, and the human condition, centering around the tumultuous relationships within the Karamazov family and the philosophical debates they engage in.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A classic novel portraying the tragic consequences of forbidden love and societal expectations, set against the backdrop of 19th-century Russian aristocracy.

author: Emily BrontÃ«
description: A dark and passionate tale of love and revenge, unfolding on the desolate moors of Yorkshire, as the unconventional relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw shapes the destiny of Wuthering Heights.

author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem that narrates the events of the Trojan War, featuring heroes and gods in a timeless exploration of honor, glory, and the consequences of war.

author: Homer
description: A legendary tale of Odysseus's epic journey home after the Trojan War, filled with mythical creatures, challenges, and encounters, showcasing the hero's cunning and perseverance.
